intro: Zehneria garcinii, commonly known as the African violet, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30-60 cm, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by birds, particularly sunbirds, and it thrives in humid, shaded environments with well-drained soil.
